intro: Euphrasia collina var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It has hairy, narrow leaves and is often found in high-altitude environments. Euphrasia collina var. alpina is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
